DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Analyte 28s/16s Ribosomal RNA Band Ratio Quality Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 28S/18S ribosomal RNA band ratio used to assess the quality of total RNA.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Analyte 28S Ribosomal RNA 16S Mitochondrial Ribosomal RNA Chromosome Band Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The sample or material being subjected to analysis._The largest of the three RNA components of the mammalian ribosome._16S mitochondrial ribosomal RNA is encoded by the human MT-RNR2 gene. This ribonucleotide is involved in mitochondrial protein translation._Chromosomal bands observed after staining with specific dyes.  The band pattern is the result of differential interactions between the dye and nonadjacent chromosomal regions._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Analyte 28S Ribosomal RNA 16S Mitochondrial Ribosomal RNA Chromosome Band Ratio
Property.preferredDefinition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.:The largest of the three RNA components of the mammalian ribosome.:16S mitochondrial ribosomal RNA is encoded by the human MT-RNR2 gene. This ribonucleotide is involved in mitochondrial protein translation.:Chromosomal bands observed after staining with specific dyes.  The band pattern is the result of differential interactions between the dye and nonadjacent chromosomal regions.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.
The largest of the three RNA components of the mammalian ribosome.
16S mitochondrial ribosomal RNA is encoded by the human MT-RNR2 gene. This ribonucleotide is involved in mitochondrial protein translation.
Chromosomal bands observed after staining with specific dyes.  The band pattern is the result of differential interactions between the dye and nonadjacent chromosomal regions.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed with a max of 6 characters and 2 decimals, units of measure not specified.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
